attributes.action: Prevent the closure of rural post offices in the United Kingdom
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are concerned that many rural post offices may close in the near future. 

Non-urban post offices provide a vital service for people living in rural areas, particularly as many of them provide additional services important for village life.

It will be sad day for Britain if all our villages become commuter ‘dead zones’. 

Subsidising rural post offices can be justified, as the economic consequences of saving money now through their closure could be catastrophic for future generations.

rejection.details:
There is already a very similar petition online:
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/sub-post-offices/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
